criteria: Differentiation Between Bullying and Other Behaviors
descriptions: The student demonstrates no understanding of the characteristics of bullying.
The student can identify one or two characteristics of bullying with significant prompting.
The student can identify some characteristics of bullying with some prompting.
The student can identify several characteristics of bullying with minimal prompting.
The student can independently identify most characteristics of bullying and provide examples.
The student can comprehensively identify and explain various characteristics of bullying, providing relevant examples and demonstrating a nuanced understanding.
The student cannot apply knowledge of bullying characteristics to real-life scenarios.
The student struggles to apply knowledge of bullying characteristics to simple scenarios, even with guidance.
The student can apply knowledge of bullying characteristics to simple scenarios with some difficulty.
The student can apply knowledge of bullying characteristics to straightforward scenarios.
The student can apply knowledge of bullying characteristics to various scenarios, including complex ones.
The student can expertly apply knowledge of bullying characteristics to diverse and complex scenarios, demonstrating critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
The student cannot differentiate between bullying and other behaviors like teasing or conflict.
The student struggles to differentiate between bullying and other behaviors, even with clear examples.
The student can differentiate between bullying and other behaviors in simple cases with some assistance.
The student can differentiate between bullying and other behaviors in most cases.
The student can clearly differentiate between bullying and other behaviors, explaining the key distinctions.
The student can expertly differentiate between bullying and other behaviors, providing nuanced explanations of the differences and demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of the context.
